attribute.description: Processor fabric broadcast scope configuration. Provided by the MRW.
Processor fabric topology mode, determines format of the topology ID. MODE0 = GGG_C (max 8x2) MODE1 = GG_CC (max 4x4) Provided by the MRW.
Processor fabric topology ID associated with this chip. Provided by the MRW.
Indicates if the given chip should serve as the fabric system master.
Indicates if the given chip should serve as the fabric group master.

Per-link optics configuration OPT0 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NV OPT1 = SMPA/SMPX OPT2 = SMPA/SMPX OPT3 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NX OPT4 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NV OPT5 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NV OPT6 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NV OPT7 = SMPA/SMPX/OCAPI/NV Provided by the MRW.
Processor optics bus width per link. Provided by the MRW.
Indicates if the endpoint target is actively being used as a fabric link
Indicates which sublinks should be initialized/trained
For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies whether or not the chip at the receiving end of the link is present and configured
Contains the total number of active X links on this chip
For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies whether or not the chip at the receiving end of the link is present and configured
Contains the total number of active A links on this chip

For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies the fabric ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies the link ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies the fabric ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies the link ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Indicates if X links on this chip should be configured in aggregate mode.
Indicates if link should be used to carry data only (in aggregate configurations). Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

Average of local/remote end link delay counter values. Used to designate coherent link in aggregate configurations. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Indicates if A links on this chip should be configured in aggregate mode.
Indicates if link should be used to carry data only (in aggregate configurations). Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

Average of local/remote end link delay counter values. Used to designate coherent link in aggregate configurations. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Fabric topology ID table configuration. Used to indicate whether the topology ID table entry is valid.

Fabric topology ID table configuration. Used to represent the corresponding ID for each topology ID table entry. Each topology ID table entry is programmed with the A/X link ID that routes this chip to the target chip identified by the topology ID table index. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_TID_TABLE_ENTRY_VALID index is true.
Guardband percentage to apply to baseline epsilon calculations Set by p10_fbc_eff_config.
Processor epsilon table type. Used to calculate the processor nest epsilon register values. Provided by the MRW.
Calculated read tier0 epsilon protection count.
Calculated read tier1 epsilon protection count.
Calculated read tier2 epsilon protection count.
Calculated write tier1 epsilon protection count.
Calculated write tier2 epsilon protection count.
Define context for current phase of system IPL.
Indicates if current IPL is memory-preserving.

The physical capacity of each msel region is 16_TB without extended addressing. This attribute defines the maximum addressable space to be used within each msel, which may be lower than the physical capacity.

Define placement policy/scheme for non-mirrored/mirrored memory layout NORMAL = non-mirrored start: 0, mirrored start: 1024TB FLIPPED = mirrored start: 0, non-mirrored start: 512TB Set by platform. Used by mss_eff_grouping.

The address where each memory group starts in the non-mirrored memory groups stack. This address is determined by the memory grouping process based on the sizes of the memory groups formed in each processor. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping.

The memory size of each non-mirrored memory group in the non-mirrored memory groups stack. This size is determined by the memory grouping process based on the amount of memory behind the ports that are grouped together. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping.

The address where each memory group starts in the mirrored memory groups stack. This address is determined by the memory grouping process based on the sizes of the memory groups formed in each processor. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping.

The memory size of each memory group in the mirrored memory groups stack. This size is determined by the memory grouping process based on the amount of memory behind the ports that are grouped together. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping.

Determines the stride covered by each granule in an interleaving group. The default stride -- 128B -- is the only value intended for production FW use. All other combinations are for experimental performance evaluation.
Regardless of this attribute value, groups of size 1, 3, and 6 will be forced to 128B stride based on the logic capabilities.
An 8 bit vector that would be a designation of which MC are involved in the group. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping.
Creator: mss_setup_bars A numerical number indicating if the memory procedures are complete. written by mss_setup_bars when the bars are now functional in the processor.

REQUIRED: HW mirroring is enabled, and all channels are required to be part of a mirrored group. REQUESTED: HW mirroring is enabled. Mirroring will be configured for groups which support it, but not all channels are required to be mirrored. OFF: HW mirroring is disabled. Provided by the MRW.

The actual non-mirrored base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming and would be acknowleged on the fabric. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p10_setup_bars.
The actual non-mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p10_setup_bars.

The actual mirrored base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming and would be acknowleged on the fabric. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p10_setup_bars.
The actual mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming. Set by p10_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p10_setup_bars.
